channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: World Briefing: Libya: Swiss Red Cross Worker Is Killed
item.description: Gunmen in the central Libyan city of Surt fatally shot a Swiss man working for the Red Cross on Wednesday, the humanitarian group said in a statement.
item.dc:creator: By KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: World Briefing: Finland: Woman Is Arrested After 5 Babies’ Bodies Are Found
item.description: The Finnish police said Wednesday that they had arrested a 35-year-old woman on suspicion of manslaughter after finding the bodies of five babies in an apartment building in the western city of Oulu.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Canada: Prostitution Bill Targets Clients
item.description: The government of Canada introduced legislation on Wednesday that would criminalize buying sexual services but would not, in many situations, make selling them illegal.
item.dc:creator: By IAN AUSTEN

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: India’s Feudal Rapists
item.description: You can’t understand sexual violence in India without understanding caste.
item.dc:creator: By AMANA FONTANELLA-KHAN

item.title: Germany Begins Inquiry of U.S. in Surveillance Case
item.description: After pressure from members of Parliament, Germany’s federal prosecutor announced a formal investigation into the tapping of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s cellphone.
item.dc:creator: By ALISON SMALE

item.title: Lithuania Moves Closer to Joining Euro Zone
item.description: Of the seven other European Union countries slated to join, none meet all the criteria for economic performance, budget discipline or central bank independence.
item.dc:creator: By JACK EWING and JAMES KANTER
item.media:description: Outside a bank in Vilnius, Lithuania, in May.

item.title: 6 Pakistani Soldiers Killed in Militant Attack
item.description: Suspected Islamist militants killed six soldiers and three civilians in separate attacks that offered the clearest indication yet that faltering peace talks with the Taliban had effectively collapsed.
item.dc:creator: By SALMAN MASOOD and DECLAN WALSH
item.media:description: A security force vehicle was removed from the site of a suicide attack on Wednesday in Rawalpindi.

item.title: Memo From London: In Elections Across the World, Democracy Is a Matter of Definition
item.description: Presidential votes in Egypt and Syria have represented a triumph of process and imagery over democracy’s supposed essence.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL
item.media:description: A train station in Damasus decorated with posters of President Bashar al-Assad, whose election to a third seven-year term is all but assured.

item.title: Europe Struggles to Avoid Deflation’s Grip
item.description: Economists fear that an outbreak of ultralow inflation across the 18-nation euro zone is doing more harm than good to the bloc’s economic recovery.
item.dc:creator: By LIZ ALDERMAN

item.title: Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl Was Exchanged for Detainees at Guantánamo
item.description: The video released on Wednesday that showed the transfer of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl to American troops and an insurgent’s warning, “don’t come back,” provided the Taliban an opportunity to publicize their argument that they represent a legitimate state in exile.
item.dc:creator: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG

item.title: After Bribery Scandals, a Pattern of Quiet Departures at Walmart
item.description: At least eight senior executives have left the giant retailer since reports of bribery in its international division surfaced two years ago.
item.dc:creator: By ELIZABETH A. HARRIS
item.media:description: Shoppers outside a Walmart store in Mexico City.

item.title: Former Ambassador to Syria Faults U.S. Stance Toward Rebels
item.description: Robert S. Ford said had left his job because Americans were not doing enough to support moderate opponents to President Bashar al-Assad.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: Robert S. Ford, the former United States ambassador to Syria.

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: June 4
item.description: The soccer World Cup tournament will begin in Sao Paulo in Brazil on June 12.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: At War Blog: My Wars Are Ending
item.description: Last week, President Obama, speaking at West Point, made clear that the end of combat in Afghanistan is near. An Air Force officer who deployed to Iraq and Afghanistan struggles to find clarity about what it all meant.
item.dc:creator: By MATTHEW KOMATSU
item.media:description: The author gearing up for a mission in July 2008 at Kandahar Airfield in Afghanistan.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Live-Blogging the Tiananmen Square Anniversary
item.description: New York Times reporters live blog the 25th anniversary of the Tiananmen Square crackdown from Beijing, Hong Kong and beyond.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: Soldiers from the Chinese People's Liberation Army march in front of the Monument to the People's Heroes in Tiananmen Square on Tuesday.

item.title: In Ukraine, Separatist Militia With Russian Fighters Holds a Key
item.description: The Vostok Battalion’s composition has raised questions about Russia’s role in eastern Ukraine. Its resolve could determine how long the fighting continues.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW ROTH

item.title: Iran’s Leader Says Obama Has Removed Military Option
item.description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei’s remarks were his first response to President Obama’s speech last week asserting that military force is not always the answer.
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS ERDBRINK
item.media:description: Ayatollah Khamenei, Iran's supreme leader, delivered a speech marking the 25th anniversary of the death of his predecessor, Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, the founder of the Islamic Republic who died in 1989.

item.title: Kerry Makes Unannounced Trip to Lebanon
item.description: Secretary of State John Kerry called for an end to the political stalemate in Lebanon, saying it is “deeply troubling” at a time of instability in the region.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Assad’s Win Is Assured, but Limits Are Exposed
item.description: The election is certain to confirm Bashar al-Assad’s hold on power amid a civil war that has killed an estimated 160,000 Syrians.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: Syrian voters at a polling station in Damascus.

item.title: India Ink: Dalit Protesters In Delhi Sit-In Brush With Police
item.description: A group of families from a low-ranking caste fear eviction from a protest venue in Delhi after the police forcibly removed their tents there.
item.dc:creator: By VISHNU VARMA
item.media:description: Members of the Dalit families from Bhagana village in Haryana protesting along with social workers and activists near the Parliament Street police station in New Delhi on Wednesday.

item.title: Crowds Gather in Hong Kong for 25th Anniversary of Tiananmen Killings
item.description: Tens of thousands turned out in Hong Kong, but in mainland China, a stifling security presence on the streets and online appeared to forestall any protests.
item.dc:creator: By KEITH BRADSHER
item.media:description: Students commemorated China's 1989 Tiananmen Square events before a candlelight vigil in Hong Kong on Wednesday.

item.title: Venice Mayor Is Arrested on Corruption Charges
item.description: Mayor Giorgio Orsoni is accused of misusing public funds from a multibillion dollar project to build underwater barriers to protect the city from flooding.
item.dc:creator: By JIM YARDLEY and GAIA PIANIGIANI
item.media:description: An underwater barrier designed to protect against flooding was tested last year in Venice. Prosecutors say public officials siphoned off funds from the project.

item.title: In Show of Support, Obama Meets With Ukraine Leader
item.description: President Obama praised Petro O. Poroshenko as representing a better future for his country, and offered $5 million in nonlethal military aid.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER
item.media:description: President Obama, right, met with President-elect Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine in Warsaw on Wednesday.

item.title: Germany Charges 3 With Terrorism
item.description: Two Lebanese brothers and a German man are accused of being involved in a radical Islamic group fighting in Syria.
item.category: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria
item.dc:creator: By MELISSA EDDY

item.title: Rebels in Eastern Ukraine Capture Government Posts
item.description: Separatist fighters had besieged a border guard command center in Luhansk for two days. A nearby internal security base was also overrun.
item.dc:creator: By SABRINA TAVERNISE
